group_1.textRight: I overheard people talking about it in the@hall just now!

group_1.textLeft: A Valentine's Monster? The heck...
Could you tell what kind of rumor it was?

group_1.narration: Where did you hear? Did you hear it all?@The Rumor of the Valentine's Monster!
Did you hear what the teacher said?@You mustn't bring any chocolate to school!
But everyone just sneaks it in!
If you give it to the boy you like@at school then...oooh no! Bad news!
It doesn't matter if he likes you back.@That rule-breaking couple will@be broken up by the monster!

group_1.textLeft: Weird...
It's pretty similar to the usual "[textBlue:Rumor]"@talk we hear...
But there're parts of it that aren't quite@right...

group_1.textRight: Wonder what's up with this one?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm, if this really is one of the [textBlue:Rumors]@we usually deal with...
We probably won't be able to take action@'til Valentine's Day itself.
Yeah.
We won't know until someone tries to give@chocolate to a boy at school.

group_1.textRight: If the Uwasa doesn't show up before then...
What are we supposed to do until@Valentine's Day?

group_1.textLeft: Good question...
It'd be great if we could solve this@ahead of time.
I mean come on...
I know that bringin' chocolates to school@basically isn't allowed.
But the teachers don't bother to stop @anyone.
And I bet there's a lot of girls that need@this chance...
...because otherwise they'd be too@nervous to say how they feel.
They shouldn't have to worry about any@of this!

group_1.textRight: You're a big people pleaser, Momoko...

group_1.textLeft: Hmmm? What was thaaat? A compliment?

group_1.textRight: What?! No! I wasn't praising you!

group_1.textLeft: Haha! You're face is bright red!
But that "[textBlue:Rumor]" might just be some@regular one... We dunno yet.
All we can do is monitor the situation 'til@we get more info.
But there's not much else.
